Rule: Couriers to obtain a signature from the receiver
Couriers will obtain a signature from the receiver when possible
Priority jobs within the same city with a consignment weight between 0-5kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs within the same city with a consignment weight between 5.01-10kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs within the same city with a consignment weight between 10.01-15kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs within the same city with a consignment weight between 15.01-20kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs within the same city with a consignment weight between 20.01-25kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs from one city to a different city with a consignment weight between 0-5kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs from one city to a different city with a consignment weight between 5.01-10kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs from one city to a different city with a consignment weight between 10.01-15kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs from one city to a different city with a consignment weight between 15.01-20kg (cubic or deadweight)
Priority jobs from one city to a different city with a consignment weight between 20.01-25kg (cubic or deadweight)
Couriers to obtain a pin from the receiver to confirm delivery
Applies if any dimension equals or exceeds 1.05m
Charged to customer following unsuccessful delivery attempt
Charged to customer following customer request for new delivery address
Per unit to be returned to sending address
Per unit above the maximum courier service threshold (25kg dead weight or 0.16m cubed volume)
Per dropwhen no data received prior to handover
Additional to each unit requiring recharge due to under declaration
